intro: Conostylis juncea var. involucrata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats such as heathlands and grasslands. It is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to withstand drought and saline conditions. The species is of interest in ecological studies due to its role in supporting local pollinators and its resilience in harsh environments.
